instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S5
threads.message:
My reference only: REF1135

Board history: Liquid damage, around J8500 there was heavy rust, parts were off. I have replaced what parts I do believe I need to at least get an image on an external monitor but no go.
USB meter shows 20v, and when I place it in to it's shell it does pull .79 amps, but it will jump down to .2 amps. 
I have been able to force it in to DFU mode but it will not revive or restore. I get the below message:
"The System cannot be restored on this device. 
Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU state.  [com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore â€“ 0xFCA (4042)]"
<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN_DLY</SIGNAL> I get 3.29v, but after a few seconds it drops to 0v, then back again to the 3.29v.
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL>: 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 0v
The board does heat up around <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.
<SIGNAL>PMU_SYS_ALIVE</SIGNAL>: 1.79v but drops to 0v after a few seconds then back to 1.79v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S5
threads.message:
You may have SSD problem.

Did you check diode mode on all secondary power rails?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S5
threads.message: I am sorry, where am I supposed to be seeing these secondary rails at on the schematics? I figured I should be using the FCT on page 83. I am used to seeing the Power Aliases in the table of contents.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No S5
threads.message:
"where am I supposed to be seeing these secondary rails at on the schematics?"
Between pages 65-74; also 81...
